domain_prompt:
DOMAIN BRIEF

# Summary
This domain models a classic blocks world with a single robot arm. Blocks can be on the table, on top of other blocks, clear on top, held by the arm, or free with the arm empty. The available actions are pick-up, put-down, stack, and unstack, each changing which block is held, which surfaces are clear, and where blocks are located.

# Object Types
- All objects are generic.

# Predicates & Functions
- on ?x ?y: Object ?x is directly on top of object ?y.
- on-table ?x: Object ?x is directly on the table.
- clear ?x: Object ?x has nothing on top of it.
- arm-empty: The robot’s arm is not holding anything.
- holding ?x: The robot’s arm is holding object ?x.

# Actions

## Action: pick-up
- Parameters: ?ob (object)
- Preconditions:
  - ?ob is clear.
  - ?ob is on-table.
  - arm-empty is true.
- Effects:
  - It is no longer the case that ?ob is on-table.
  - It is no longer the case that ?ob is clear.
  - It is no longer the case that arm-empty is true.
  - holding ?ob becomes true.

## Action: put-down
- Parameters: ?ob (object)
- Preconditions:
  - holding ?ob is true.
- Effects:
  - It is no longer the case that holding ?ob is true.
  - clear ?ob becomes true.
  - arm-empty becomes true.
  - on-table ?ob becomes true.

## Action: stack
- Parameters: ?ob (object), ?under (object)
- Preconditions:
  - holding ?ob is true.
  - ?under is clear.
- Effects:
  - It is no longer the case that holding ?ob is true.
  - It is no longer the case that ?under is clear.
  - clear ?ob becomes true.
  - arm-empty becomes true.
  - on ?ob ?under becomes true.

## Action: unstack
- Parameters: ?ob (object), ?under (object)
- Preconditions:
  - on ?ob ?under is true.
  - ?ob is clear.
  - arm-empty is true.
- Effects:
  - holding ?ob becomes true.
  - clear ?under becomes true.
  - It is no longer the case that ?ob is clear.
  - It is no longer the case that arm-empty is true.
  - It is no longer the case that on ?ob ?under is true.

FINAL CHECK
- All action names are identical to the PDDL.
- All Lisp syntax has been removed and replaced with clear English.
- All preconditions and effects are included and logically complete.

actions.name: pick-up
preconditions: Block X is on the table.
Block X is clear (nothing on top of it).
effects: The hand is holding block X.
Block X is no longer on the table.
Block X is no longer clear (because it is being held).
The hand is no longer empty.

actions.name: put-down
preconditions: The hand is holding block X.
effects: The hand is no longer holding block X.
Block X is on the table.

actions.name: stack
preconditions: The hand is holding block X.
Block Y is clear (nothing on top of it).
effects: The hand is no longer holding block X.
Block X is on top of block Y.
Block Y is no longer clear.

actions.name: unstack
preconditions: Block X is on top of block Y.
Block X is clear (nothing on top of it).
effects: The hand is holding block X.
The hand is no longer empty.
Block X is no longer on top of block Y.
Block X is no longer clear (because it is being held).

problems.prompt:
INSTANCE BRIEF

# Summary
Arrange three blocks into a tower: A on B, and B on C.

# Objects
- Objects: A, B, C

# Initial State
- The robot’s arm is empty.
- A is on the table.
- B is on the table.
- C is on the table.
- A is clear.
- B is clear.
- C is clear.

# Goal State
(The plan is successful only when the following are TRUE)
- A is on B.
- B is on C.

# Optimization Metric
- None - Just satisfy goals.

FINAL CHECK
- Object names A, B, C match the PDDL exactly.
- No Lisp syntax is used.
- No hints or plans are included.

overview.description: Rearrange blocks to satisfy the goal stacking configuration.
overview.initial_state: A, B, C are each on the table and clear; the hand is empty.
overview.goal: A is on B and B is on C (tower top->bottom: A, B, C).

problems.prompt:
INSTANCE BRIEF

# Summary
Rearrange three blocks using a single robot arm. Start with B on A and C on the table. Build a new tower where A is on C and B is on A.

# Objects
- Objects: A, B, C

# Initial State
- The robot arm is empty.
- B is on A.
- A is on the table.
- C is on the table.
- B is clear.
- C is clear.

# Goal State
(The plan is successful only when the following are TRUE)
- A is on C.
- B is on A.

# Optimization Metric
- None - Just satisfy goals.

FINAL CHECK
- All object names (A, B, C) match the PDDL exactly.
- No Lisp-style syntax is used.
- No hints or plans are provided.

overview.description: Rearrange blocks to satisfy the goal stacking configuration.
overview.initial_state: B is on A (A on the table); C is on the table. B and C are clear; the hand is empty.
overview.goal: A is on C and B is on A (tower top->bottom: B, A, C).

problems.prompt:
INSTANCE BRIEF

# Summary
Reverse a three-block tower: start with a vertical stack C on B on A on the table, and achieve A on B and B on C.

# Objects
- Objects: A, B, C

# Initial State
- The robot’s arm is empty.
- A is on the table.
- B is on A.
- C is on B.
- C is clear.

# Goal State
(The plan is successful only when the following are TRUE)
- A is on B.
- B is on C.

# Optimization Metric
- None - Just satisfy goals.

FINAL CHECK
- All object names match the PDDL exactly: A, B, C.
- No Lisp syntax is used.
- No hints or plans are provided.

overview.description: Rearrange blocks to satisfy the goal stacking configuration.
overview.initial_state: C is on B and B is on A (A on the table). C is clear; the hand is empty.
overview.goal: A is on B and B is on C (tower top->bottom: A, B, C).

problems.prompt:
INSTANCE BRIEF

# Summary
Merge two separate two-block towers into a single four-block tower with the order from top to bottom: A, B, C, D.

# Objects
- Objects: A, B, C, D

# Initial State
- The robot’s arm is empty.
- A is on B.
- B is on the table.
- D is on C.
- C is on the table.
- A is clear.
- D is clear.

# Goal State
(The plan is successful only when the following are TRUE)
- A is on B.
- B is on C.
- C is on D.

# Optimization Metric
- None - Just satisfy goals.

FINAL CHECK
- All object names match the PDDL exactly: A, B, C, D.
- No Lisp syntax is present.
- No action hints or plans are included.

overview.description: Merge two stacks into a single target tower.
overview.initial_state: Two towers: A on B (B on the table) and D on C (C on the table). A and D are clear; the hand is empty.
overview.goal: A on B on C on D (top->bottom: A, B, C, D).

problems.prompt:
INSTANCE BRIEF

# Summary
This instance presents a block manipulation task starting with a single tower D on C on B on A. The objective is to rearrange the blocks to form a specific closed-loop configuration.

# Objects
- Objects: A, B, C, D

# Initial State
- The robot’s arm is empty.
- A is on the table.
- B is on A.
- C is on B.
- D is on C.
- D is clear.

# Goal State
(The plan is successful only when the following are TRUE)
- A is on B.
- B is on C.
- C is on A.

# Optimization Metric
- None - Just satisfy goals.

FINAL CHECK
- All object names match exactly: A, B, C, D.
- No Lisp syntax is used.
- No hints or plans are included.

overview.description: Attempt to create a circular stacking configuration (A on B, B on C, C on A).
overview.initial_state: D on C on B on A (A on the table). D is clear; the hand is empty.
overview.goal: A on B, B on C, and C on A (Impossible Cycle).

problems.prompt:
INSTANCE BRIEF

# Summary
Arrange five blocks into a single tower so that E is on D, D is on C, C is on B, and B is on A, starting from all blocks separate on the table with the arm empty.

# Objects
- Objects: A, B, C, D, E

# Initial State
- The robot arm is empty.
- A is on the table.
- B is on the table.
- C is on the table.
- D is on the table.
- E is on the table.
- A is clear.
- B is clear.
- C is clear.
- D is clear.
- E is clear.

# Goal State
(The plan is successful only when the following are TRUE)
- E is on D.
- D is on C.
- C is on B.
- B is on A.

# Optimization Metric
- None - Just satisfy goals.

FINAL CHECK
- All object names match exactly: A, B, C, D, E.
- No Lisp syntax is used.
- No hints or plans are included.

overview.description: Build a single tall tower from individually separated blocks.
overview.initial_state: A, B, C, D, E are each on the table and clear; the hand is empty.
overview.goal: E on D on C on B on A (top->bottom: E, D, C, B, A).

problems.prompt:
INSTANCE BRIEF

# Summary
Merge two existing towers of blocks into a new configuration. The goal specifies the position of block A relative to both B and C simultaneously.

# Objects
- Objects: A, B, C, D, E

# Initial State
- The robot’s arm is empty.
- B is on A.
- C is on B.
- A is on the table.
- E is on D.
- D is on the table.
- C is clear.
- E is clear.

# Goal State
(The plan is successful only when the following are TRUE)
- A is on B.
- A is on C.
- C is on D.
- D is on E.

# Optimization Metric
- None - Just satisfy goals.

FINAL CHECK
- All object names (A, B, C, D, E) match the PDDL exactly.
- No Lisp syntax is used.
- No hints or plans are provided.

overview.description: Attempt to stack A on two different blocks (B and C) simultaneously.
overview.initial_state: C on B on A (A on the table) and E on D (D on the table). C and E are clear; the hand is empty.
overview.goal: A on B AND A on C, plus C on D on E. (Physically Impossible).

problems.prompt:
INSTANCE BRIEF

# Summary
Arrange five blocks into a single tower by merging three separate stacks into one.

# Objects
- Objects: A, B, C, D, E

# Initial State
- The robot’s arm is empty.
- B is on A.
- A is on the table.
- D is on C.
- C is on the table.
- E is on the table.
- B is clear on top.
- D is clear on top.
- E is clear on top.

# Goal State
(The plan is successful only when the following are TRUE)
- C is on D.
- D is on B.
- B is on A.
- A is on E.

# Optimization Metric
- None - Just satisfy goals.

FINAL CHECK
- All object names match the PDDL exactly: A, B, C, D, E.
- No Lisp syntax is used.
- No hints or plans are included.

overview.description: Combine multiple stacks into one target tower ordering.
overview.initial_state: Three stacks: B on A (A on the table), D on C (C on the table), and E alone on the table. B, D, E are clear; the hand is empty.
overview.goal: C on D on B on A on E (top->bottom: C, D, B, A, E).

problems.prompt:
INSTANCE BRIEF

# Summary
Build a single six-block tower from scratch using one robot arm.

# Objects
- Objects: A, B, C, D, E, F

# Initial State
- The robot’s arm is empty.
- A is on the table.
- B is on the table.
- C is on the table.
- D is on the table.
- E is on the table.
- F is on the table.
- A is clear.
- B is clear.
- C is clear.
- D is clear.
- E is clear.
- F is clear.

# Goal State
(The plan is successful only when the following are TRUE)
- F is on E.
- E is on D.
- D is on C.
- C is on B.
- B is on A.

# Optimization Metric
- None - Just satisfy goals.

FINAL CHECK
- All object names match the PDDL exactly: A, B, C, D, E, F.
- No Lisp syntax is present.
- No hints or plans are included.

overview.description: Build a single tall tower from individually separated blocks.
overview.initial_state: A, B, C, D, E, F are each on the table and clear; the hand is empty.
overview.goal: F on E on D on C on B on A (top->bottom: F, E, D, C, B, A).

problems.prompt:
INSTANCE BRIEF

# Summary
Merge two existing towers of blocks into a single seven-block tower with A on top and G on the bottom.

# Objects
- Objects: A, B, C, D, E, F, G

# Initial State
- The robot arm is empty.
- C is on B.
- B is on A.
- A is on the table.
- G is on F.
- F is on E.
- E is on D.
- D is on the table.
- C is clear.
- G is clear.

# Goal State
(The plan is successful only when the following are TRUE)
- A is on B.
- B is on C.
- C is on D.
- D is on E.
- E is on F.
- F is on G.

# Optimization Metric
- None - Just satisfy goals.

FINAL CHECK
- All object names are exactly A, B, C, D, E, F, G.
- No Lisp syntax is present.
- No hints or plans are included.

overview.description: Merge two tall stacks into one target tower ordering.
overview.initial_state: Two towers: C on B on A (A on the table) and G on F on E on D (D on the table). C and G are clear; the hand is empty.
overview.goal: A on B on C on D on E on F on G (top->bottom: A, B, C, D, E, F, G).
